sentences.sContent: The Mega-Sonic Scatter-Cat Repeller looks like a megaphone because it actually is one.
sentences.sContent_eng: The Mega-Sonic Scatter-Cat Repeller looks like a megaphone because it actually is one.
sentences.sCn: 这个超音波驱猫器看上去像个扩音器，因为它的确是的。

sentences.sContent: With a price tag estimated in the billions of dollars, the new Xinhua is an expensive megaphone.
sentences.sContent_eng: With a price tag estimated in the billions of dollars, the new Xinhua is an expensive megaphone.
sentences.sCn: 据估计，新的新华社的市值为数十亿美元，看起来就像是一只昂贵的扩音器。

sentences.sContent: There was just one announcement over the megaphone, about 30 minutes before the ship tilted to its side.
sentences.sContent_eng: There was just one announcement over the megaphone, about 30 minutes before the ship tilted to its side.
sentences.sCn: 船上只用扩音器通知了一次，约30分钟后船就向一边倾斜。

trans.tranOther: a piece of equipment like a large horn which you talk through to make your voice sound louder, when you are speaking to a crowd
